system.description:
All quori have the following special abilities.

  • Arcane Resistance: Quori have the @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-edges.Item.3Tkb9OczC6HXzd0Z]{Arcane Resistance} Edge.

  • Darksight: Quori can see in complete darkness.

  • Environmental Resistance (Acid): +4 resistance / −4 damage from acid or acid-based effects.

  • Environmental Resistance (Cold): +4 resistance / −4 damage from cold or ice-based effects.

  • Environmental Resistance (Heat): +4 resistance / −4 damage from heat or fire-based effects.

  • Fearless: Quori are immune to @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.FKawDwaCdCRij7eO]{Fear} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Item.TlMOxNi4U4YOnHId]{Intimidation}.

  • Immunities: Quori cannot be affected by @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.UFQy5B0Egwhm96uM]{slumber}.

  • Innate Powers: Major @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.iwfXTfzMqC1gWWtw]{mind link}, major teleport (Greater Teleport, self only).

  • Invade Dreams: A quori on Dal Quor can use @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.iwfXTfzMqC1gWWtw]{mind link} to communicate with a creature on another plane through its dreams. During this connection, it can change its appearance to any living creature it desires as if using @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.nz69DP0tjQGxYtcI]{disguise} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.fK9adaURLKcCGv99]{shape change}. It can also use the nightmares power with any dreaming creature while on Dal Quor.

  • Possession: A quori can possess any willing human in sight as an action. The human vessel cannot be protected by any form of protection from supernatural evil. First, the quori spirit must depart its physical body on Dal Quor and become an ethereal spirit on the Ethereal Plane. The body remains in a state of suspended animation and is vulnerable to physical attacks and environmental damage. If the quori body is destroyed, the quori spirit dies with it. Casting @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.aqzVQ4fRrk7OYqgx]{dispel} on the quori body returns the quori spirit to it. During possession, the quori spirit is in complete control and has access to all the human’s thoughts and memories. Physically harming the human vessel does not harm the quori. If the human vessel dies, the quori returns to the Ethereal Plane and can attempt another possession. The quori spirit can use its powers while possessing a human vessel. It can also use the higher of its or the human vessel’s Smarts and Spirit attributes and combine its skills with the human vessel’s skills. While possessed, the human vessel gains an additional +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Item.k7fIVOghEx6y44xE]{Persuasion} rolls and Tests based on Smarts- or Spirit-linked skills. Successfully casting the exorcism power on the possessed body as a ritual sends the quori spirit back to Dal Quor.

Arcane Resistance

Magic and the supernatural hold little sway with this individual. Whether by nature, heritage, or training the character is particularly resistant to magic and other supernatural energies.

Enemy arcane abilities targeting the hero suffer a -2 penalty and magical damage is reduced by 2 as well. If a hostile power fails to affect the hero due to this penalty, it still activates and consumes Power Points (and may still affect other targets). This includes magical bonuses granted to weapons, such as the smite power or the damage bonus of magical weapons.
Quori can see in complete darkness.
Environmental Resistance (Acid): +4 resistance / −4 damage from acid or acid-based effects.
Environmental Resistance (Cold): +4 resistance / −4 damage from cold or ice-based effects.
Environmental Resistance (Heat): +4 resistance / −4 damage from heat or fire-based effects.

Mindless creatures, some undead, robots, and the like don’t suffer from the weaknesses of the mortal mind. Fearless creatures are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Fear]{Fear} effects and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation}. They may still be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunted}, however (usually because it draws their attention rather than causing emotional distress).
Quori cannot be affected by @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.UFQy5B0Egwhm96uM]{slumber}.

@UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-abilities.Item.ETINOxDyaOs5zKBl]{Innate Powers}: Major @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.iwfXTfzMqC1gWWtw]{mind link}, minor @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.cuuokKqJ5IgaYdNT]{protection}, major @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.4grJTfjDjDVLUi5t]{teleport} (Greater Teleport, self only)

Invade Dreams: A quori on Dal Quor can use @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.iwfXTfzMqC1gWWtw]{mind link} to communicate with a creature on another plane through its dreams. During this connection, it can change its appearance to any living creature it desires as if using @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.nz69DP0tjQGxYtcI]{disguise} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.fK9adaURLKcCGv99]{shape change}. It can also use the nightmares power with any dreaming creature while on Dal Quor.

Possession: A quori can possess any willing human in sight as an action. The human vessel cannot be protected by any form of protection from supernatural evil. First, the quori spirit must depart its physical body on Dal Quor and become an ethereal spirit on the Ethereal Plane. The body remains in a state of suspended animation and is vulnerable to physical attacks and environmental damage. If the quori body is destroyed, the quori spirit dies with it. Casting @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.aqzVQ4fRrk7OYqgx]{dispel} on the quori body returns the quori spirit to it. During possession, the quori spirit is in complete control and has access to all the human’s thoughts and memories. Physically harming the human vessel does not harm the quori. If the human vessel dies, the quori returns to the Ethereal Plane and can attempt another possession. The quori spirit can use its powers while possessing a human vessel. It can also use the higher of its or the human vessel’s Smarts and Spirit attributes and combine its skills with the human vessel’s skills. While possessed, the human vessel gains an additional +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Item.k7fIVOghEx6y44xE]{Persuasion} rolls and Tests based on Smarts- or Spirit-linked skills. Successfully casting the exorcism power on the possessed body as a ritual sends the quori spirit back to Dal Quor.

Mind link creates a telepathic connection between two individuals (which does not necessarily have to include the caster). The link accommodates only willing subjects and communication—thoughts that aren’t consciously transmitted aren’t relayed.

Once @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{activated}, the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} between all linked minds is one mile, or five with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{raise}.

If any of the linked characters suffers a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound}, all others must make a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll or be @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Shaken} (this cannot cause a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound}).

The speed of communication is that of normal speech, but with a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{raise} members may communicate up to 30 seconds or so of speech on a single combat turn.

Modifiers

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect additional individuals for 1 additonal @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point} each.
system.trapping: Headpieces, talismans, of Tao or other gods, crystals

system.description:
Protection creates a field of energy or armor around a character, giving him 2 points of Armor. With a raise, the bonus is applied to Toughness instead (and therefore immune to Armor Piercing modifiers).

Whether the protection is visible or not depends on the Trapping-this is entirely up to the caster.

Protection stacks with all other armor, natural or worn.

Modifiers
  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect additional targets at a cost of 1 Power Point each.
system.trapping: A mystical glow, bark skin, mage armor, ethereal armor

system.description:
Teleport allows a character to disappear and instantly reappear up to 12″ (24 yards) distant, or double that with a raise.

Opponents adjacent to a character who teleports away don't get a free attack (see Withdrawing from Melee in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor00introd.JournalEntryPage.00introduction00]{Savage Worlds}).

If casting teleport on willing subjects, the caster decides where they move to, not the targets.

Modifiers
  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Gate (+5): Instead of teleporting, the caster opens a temporary portal connecting her current location and the destination. Creatures and objects can travel through this gate from either side for 5 rounds.
  • Greater Teleport (+5): The character can teleport much farther. The caster must concentrate on her destination for at least one round, taking no other actions. This makes her Vulnerable; if Shaken or Stunned, the spell fails.

    For one round of concentration, the character can teleport up to 100 miles. For two rounds, she can travel 1000 miles, and with three rounds, she can go anywhere in the world.

    If the caster has physically been to the desired location previously, there is no penalty to her roll. With success she arrives within 2d6 × 10 feet of her target, or on target with a raise.

    If the caster has a detailed map or has seen it through a power or device, she suffers -2 to the roll. With success, she arrives within 2d6 × 100 feet, or on target with a raise.

    If the caster has a crude map or a general notion of the place on a regional or world map, she suffers a -4. She arrives within 2d10 miles with success, or within 2d6 × 100 feet with a raise.

    In the absence of such information, teleporting is not possible.

    A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} transports the recipient to a random location (GM's call) on the same plane of existence.

  • Teleport Foe (+2): Foes may be targeted at a Range of Touch. The foe resists the casting with an opposed Spirit roll against the arcane skill total and is sent up to 12″ away with success and 24″ with a raise. Foes may not be teleported into solid objects.
system.trapping: A cloud of smoke, “phasing” out, change into a bolt of lightning.

system.description: A tsucora quori has dozens of eyes covering its body. It gains a +2 bonus to sight-based Notice rolls.

effects.name: +2 to sight-based Notice rolls
effects.description: A tsucora quori has dozens of eyes covering its body. It gains a +2 bonus to sight-based Notice rolls.

system.description: If a tsucora quori successfully wounds a creature with its sting, it can automatically activate the @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.FKawDwaCdCRij7eO]{fear} power against it.

Your warrior is as deft with his left hand as he is with his right. He ignores the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03offhandattac00]{Off-Hand Penalty}

If holding a weapon in each hand, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Ambidextrous]{Ambidextrous} characters may stack @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} bonuses (if any) from both weapons.

Psionicists tap into their own mental energy to manipulate matter, read minds, and far more. Some are agents in the employ of a vast government agency, while others are often on the run from them! Some may have years of training or they might have developed their incredible powers in isolation

  • Requirements: Smarts d6+

  • Arcane Skill: Psionics (Smarts)

  • Starting Powers: 3

  • Power Points: 15

  • Available Powers: @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.qjflUvZxnhUF91dS]{arcane protection}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.0TRRYoKZecpUZMBv]{barrier}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.FxOCy159uyCtmvST]{blast}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.gFuuLSXl02lUajWK]{blind}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.Jgm2DqNWxAxi62Ur]{bolt}, @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-powers.Item.CfscQ3htdj1OA6Zh]{boost/lower Trait}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.ypEHp2qylYsib3Td]{burst}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.FxiWV5YVRzqxioo7]{confusion}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.MQMboOtLOdzoVdIr]{damage field}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.AlM4OxVDzViyoFiE]{darksight}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.pnhihi2oBjsjsh4N]{deflection}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.sXrRk20IIFPhxkC0]{detect/conceal arcana}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.nz69DP0tjQGxYtcI]{disguise}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.aqzVQ4fRrk7OYqgx]{dispel}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.HgP5zrN7Hv6swMEr]{drain Power Points}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.MEjY7RhNahJGbfRC]{elemental manipulation}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.TVoDtWckWRZ0AnxZ]{empathy}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.QWIWVdAJ2wvLP7Zz]{entangle} (ectoplasm), @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.WZqqKZ1mnquK2fdo]{farsight}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.FKawDwaCdCRij7eO]{fear}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.lPSFNaeFMJlbZXYM]{fly}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.XR6ezIMYpEj53GHT]{healing} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-powers.Item.XOu5NA90SagVeHT5]{illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.DRY74t2m98JCjUpo]{intangibility}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.6pIk2UHMWPBiAmCk]{invisibility} (cloud mind), @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.bTcP0C22uRVijOeU]{light/darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-powers.Item.rFmzKP8HDWYHdsP9]{locate}, @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-powers.Item.eBC6qxC9WZFYmaiK]{mind blank}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.iwfXTfzMqC1gWWtw]{mind link}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.GMTgL2vLUZ0BTZ1w]{mind reading}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.7cDWA5azwTrmZaiq]{object reading}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.urLA1HNU0GqTpP9g]{plane shift}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.cuuokKqJ5IgaYdNT]{protection}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.mVT0AsyhtjeltTHF]{puppet}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.QlGf5bxHPpHwrAU5]{relief} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.H5H71b5WDDMJ7nCL]{sloth/speed}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.UFQy5B0Egwhm96uM]{slumber}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.8r70sKYB6GfzzapQ]{smite}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.MCXIMSN4YAWaM5Ei]{speak language}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.xz2NXG2RXvT8wo22]{stun}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.cq3fgyvvCp1oCIv7]{summon ally} (astral construct), @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.nE0AIeWGCGWjxxi6]{telekinesis}, @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-powers.Item.HI4K2kkaTq91VlfG]{teleport}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.7UEQMywtDyAR1zSf]{wall walker}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.ZvYOVQ9Rn5PbQswT]{warrior's gift}.

  • Psionics: Psions may take Edges that require Arcane Background (Psionics).

  • Psychic Surge: Psions can draw from their Power Points to enhance the manifestation of their powers. For 1 Power Point, they can add +1 to their Psionics roll, or +2 for 3 Power Points. This ability may not be used to improve a Critical Failure.

  • Psychic Enervation: Enhancing a power manifestation with a Psychic Surge can take a toll on a psion. After performing a Psychic Surge, the psion must immediately make a Spirit roll. Failure means the psion is Shaken. A Critical Failure means she is Stunned.

This is the skill “psions” or “psis” use to activate and control their psionic abilities. See the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Arcane Background (Psionics)]{Arcane Background (Psionics)} edge.

Psions can draw from their Power Points to enhance the manifestation of their powers. For 1 Power Point, they can add +1 to their Psionics roll, or +2 for 3 Power Points. This ability may not be used to improve a Critical Failure.

After performing a Psychic Surge, the psion might suffer from @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-abilities.Item.QpQXOjd3ni0HKSWp]{Psychic Enervation}.

Enhancing a power manifestation with a Psychic Surge can take a toll on a psion. After performing a @UUID[Compendium.savage-eberron.eberron-abilities.Item.0pU1D7qQI806xZVu]{Psychic Surge}, the psion must immediately make a Spirit roll. Failure means the psion is @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00#shaken]{Shaken}. A Critical Failure means she is @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03stunned0000000]{Stunned}.

effects.name: Mentalist
effects.description:
Constant contact with multiple minds gives these psionic agents an edge when it comes to forcing or resisting mental assaults.

Mentalists add +2 to opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Psionics]{Psionics} rolls, whether they are using their powers against a foe or defending against a rival.

system.description:
Constant contact with multiple minds gives these psionic agents an edge when it comes to forcing or resisting mental assaults.

Mentalists add +2 to opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Psionics]{Psionics} rolls, whether they are using their powers against a foe or defending against a rival.

Some occultists have expanded their knowledge beyond the supernatural elements of the Material Plane. These adventurers have either experienced the effects of or have studied the other planes of existence that influence the world. Adventurers with this Edge may make Occult rolls to identify the effects, properties, and inhabitants of any of the other 13 planes. They may also use the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Item.XMNmVhwrZmL47Vhg]{Occult} skill in place of Survival rolls while navigating through a manifest zone or any plane other than their own.

effects.name: Quick
effects.description:
Quick characters have lightning-fast reflexes and a cool head. Whenever you are dealt an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} of Five or lower, you may discard it and draw again until you get a card higher than Five.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Characters} with both the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Level Headed]{Level Headed} and Quick Edges first draw their additional card and choose which to take. If that card is a Five or less, the Quick Edge may be used to draw a replacement until it’s Six or higher.

system.description:
Quick characters have lightning-fast reflexes and a cool head. Whenever you are dealt an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} of Five or lower, you may discard it and draw again until you get a card higher than Five.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Characters} with both the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Level Headed]{Level Headed} and Quick Edges first draw their additional card and choose which to take. If that card is a Five or less, the Quick Edge may be used to draw a replacement until it’s Six or higher.

If a character makes an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Item.qc2GOKFIXIJEpTw1]{Athletics} (throwing), @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting}, or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Item.UOYD9aoLPoTZamDS]{Shooting} attack with one action and another from a different hand in a later action, the second attack doesn’t inflict a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action} penalty. The @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03offhandattac00#off-hand-attacks]{Off-Hand} penalty still applies unless he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Ambidextrous]{Ambidextrous}.

This power allows a character to increase or decrease a target's Trait (attribute or skill).

Boosting an ally's Trait increases the selected Trait one die type, or two with a raise.

Lowering an enemy's Trait has a Duration of Instant and lowers the selected attribute or skill a die type with success, or two with a raise (to a minimum of d4). A victim automatically tries to shake off the effect with a Spirit roll as a free action at the end of his following turns. Success improves

the effect one die type, and a raise removes the effect entirely.

Additional castings don't stack on a single Trait (take the highest), but may affect different Traits.

Modifiers

  • Additional Recipients (+2): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Greater Boost/Lower Trait (+2): With success, the selected Trait gains a free reroll once per round, or once per action with a raise. For lower Trait the target applies a -2 penalty to the affected Trait's rolls.

  • Moment of Prescience (+2): Boost Trait only. Add a +1 bonus for 2 additional Power Points each (+4 maximum) to a single roll made during the power’s duration.

  • Strong (+1): Lower Trait only. The Spirit roll to shake off the effect is made at -2.

This power causes overwhelming dread and horror. The target makes a Fear check. Extras who fail are Panicked and Wild Cards roll on the Fear Table. If the power is cast with a raise, the Fear roll is at -2 and Wild Cards add +2 to Fear Table results.

Modifiers
  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Small or Medium Blast Template (caster's choice). For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.
  • Greater Fear (+2): Fear rolls are made at -2, or -4 if cast with a raise.

Mind link creates a telepathic connection between two individuals (which does not necessarily have to include the caster). The link accommodates only willing subjects and communication-thoughts that aren't consciously transmitted aren't relayed.

Once activated, the Range between linked minds is one mile, or five with a raise.

If any of the linked characters suffers a Wound, all others must make a Smarts roll or be Shaken (this cannot cause a Wound).

The speed of communication is that of normal speech, but with a raise members may communicate up to 30 seconds or so of speech on a single combat turn.

Modifiers
  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect additional individuals for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Broadcast (+2): The caster can broadcast a short telepathic message to every sentient mind within Smarts ×4 radius (Smarts ×8 with a raise). The caster can only broadcast, she doesn't receive their responses.
  • Long Distance Link (+3): Casters can connect with any mind they're familiar with on the same plane of existence, regardless of distance.

Disguise allows the target to assume the appearance of another person of the same Size and shape, including clothing. It does not confer any abilities, however.

Those who have reason to question the imposter's identity make a Notice roll at -2 to see through the disguise (-4 with a raise on the casting roll). This is a free action.

Modifiers
  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Size (+1): The recipient may assume the shape of someone up to two Sizes larger or smaller than themselves.
system.trapping: Malleable features, illusionary appearance, hair of new form.

system.description:
Puppet is an opposed roll of the character's arcane skill versus the target's Spirit. With success, the victim obeys commands that don't directly harm himself or those he cares about. This includes inaction, as well, so a controlled character won't just stand idly by or leave the area if he knows his friends are in danger.

With a raise, the target will harm himself or others (including by inaction), but gets a Spirit roll as a free action. If successful, he doesn't carry out that particular command but remains a puppet. With a raise, he breaks the controller's hold and the power ends.

Commands are general, such as “attack that person” or “open that door.” The controller doesn't get to dictate how many

actions the victim uses in a turn, whether or not he uses his Sweep Edge, etc.

Modifiers
  • Additional Recipients (+2): The caster may affect others at the cost of 2 Power Points each.
  • Strong (+2): Spirit rolls to resist commands are made at -2. If the caster also uses mind link on the target, she may extend her control of him to any distance, even out of her sight.
system.trapping: Glowing eyes, trance-like state, a swinging pocket watch, voodoo dolls.

system.description:
Protection creates a field of energy or armor around a character, giving him 2 points of Armor. With a raise, the bonus is applied to Toughness instead (and therefore immune to Armor Piercing modifiers).

Whether the protection is visible or not depends on the Trapping-this is entirely up to the caster.

Protection stacks with all other armor, natural or worn.

Modifiers
  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect additional targets at a cost of 1 Power Point each.
system.trapping: A mystical glow, bark skin, mage armor, ethereal armor

system.description:
Teleport allows a character to disappear and instantly reappear up to 12″ (24 yards) distant, or double that with a raise.

Opponents adjacent to a character who teleports away don't get a free attack (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03withdrawingf00]{Withdrawing from Melee} in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor00introd.JournalEntryPage.00introduction00]{Savage Worlds}).

If casting teleport on willing subjects, the caster decides where they move to, not the targets.

Modifiers

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Gate (+5): Instead of teleporting, the caster opens a temporary portal connecting her current location and the destination. Creatures and objects can travel through this gate from either side for 5 rounds.

  • Greater Teleport (+5): The character can teleport much farther. The caster must concentrate on her destination for at least one round, taking no other actions. This makes her Vulnerable; if Shaken or Stunned, the spell fails.

    For one round of concentration, the character can teleport up to 100 miles. For two rounds, she can travel 1000 miles, and with three rounds, she can go anywhere in the world.

    If the caster has physically been to the desired location previously, there is no penalty to her roll. With success she arrives within 2d6 × 10 feet of her target, or on target with a raise.

    If the caster has a detailed map or has seen it through a power or device, she suffers -2 to the roll. With success, she arrives within 2d6 × 100 feet, or on target with a raise.

    If the caster has a crude map or a general notion of the place on a regional or world map, she suffers a -4. She arrives within 2d10 miles with success, or within 2d6 × 100 feet with a raise.

    In the absence of such information, teleporting is not possible.

    A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} transports the recipient to a random location (GM's call) on the same plane of existence.

  • Teleport Foe (+2): Foes may be targeted at a Range of Touch. The foe resists the casting with an opposed Spirit roll against the arcane skill total and is sent up to 12″ away with success and 24″ with a raise. Foes may not be teleported into solid objects.
  • Refuge (+5): The caster creates a token that she willingly gifts to another. Upon triggering with a command word, the item will either teleport the possessor and everything he is carrying to the caster’s abode or teleport the caster within 2” of the possessor of the object; the caster chooses which upon creation of the token. The Power Points used to create the token are transferred to the token and remain with it until the token is activated, @UUID[Compendium.swade-fantasy-companion.swade-fc-powers.Item.aqzVQ4fRrk7OYqgx]{dispelled}, or the power is dismissed by the caster, at which point the Power Points recharge as usual.

Telekinesis is the ability to move objects or creatures (including oneself) with arcane will. It has a Strength of d10, or d12 with a raise. On activation, the caster may immediately perform one of the “uses” below. Subsequent uses are actions and use the arcane skill (but are not activation rolls and therefore not subject to Backlash from @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.JournalEntry.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failures}).

Unwilling beings targeted by telekinesis resist the caster's arcane skill with an opposed Spirit roll when first targeted, and at the start of each of their turns thereafter until they're released. Successful resistance does not mean the spell fails-the caster may try again on his next turn.

Uses:

  • Bash: The target may be bashed into the floor, ceiling, or walls for Str+d6 damage.
  • Change Targets: The caster may release a victim or tool as a free action. Picking up a new weapon is a free action. Selecting a new unwilling target is an action and is resisted as above.
  • Manipulate: The caster may use tools to perform simple tasks or wield a weapon, using the caster's arcane skill. (This doesn't alter the caster's Parry if wielding a weapon if his arcane skill is different from his Fighting skill.)
  • Move: The target or tool may be moved up to the caster's Smarts as a limited free action.
Modifiers
  • Power (+3): The Strength of telekinesis is d12, or d12+2 with a raise. Bashing victims inflicts Str+d8 damage. Objects weighing 500 pounds or more are treated as Heavy Weapons.
system.trapping: A wave of the hand, magic wand, steely gaze.

system.description: Athletics combines an individual’s coordin­ation with learned skills such as climbing, jumping, balancing, biking, wrestling, skiing, swimming, throwing, or catching. Characters who rely on physical power more than coordination can take the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Brute]{Brute} Edge to link this skill to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} instead of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Agility}.
Characters roll Common Knowledge to know people, places, and things of their world, including etiquette, geography, culture, popular technology, contacts, and customs.

Fighting covers all hand-to-hand (melee) attacks, whether it’s with fists, axes, laser swords, or martial arts. See @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Chapter Three} for the combat rules and the various maneuvers a warrior might attempt.

Intimidation is the art of frightening an opponent so that he backs down, reveals information, or flees.

Intimidation is an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{opposed roll} resisted by the opponent’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Spirit}. In combat, this is a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test}. Out of combat, a successful roll means the foe backs down for the most part, reveals some information, or slinks away when the opportunity presents itself.

A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{raise} might mean he backs down for the remainder of the scene, spills all the beans, or runs away as fast as he can.

In or out of combat, a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure} means the target is immune to this character’s Intimidation attempts for the remainder of this encounter!

Networking: Intimidation can also be used as a “macro” skill to simulate several hours of working the streets. See @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04networking0000]{Networking} to see how to crack some heads for favors or information.

Notice is a hero’s general awareness and alertness. It’s used to sense sights, sounds, tastes, and smells, spot clues, detect ambushes, spot hidden weapons on a foe, or tell if a rival is lying, frightened, happy, etc.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Success} conveys basic information—the character hears movement in the forest, smells distant smoke, or senses someone isn’t being completely truthful.

A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{raise} grants more detail, such as the direction of a sound or odor or what topic a person is avoiding or lying about.

Occult reflects knowledge and experience with the paranormal most others don’t even believe exists. It can be used to decipher strange pictograms, recall information about supernatural creatures, remember cures for monstrous maladies like lycanthropy or vampirism, or perform rituals.

Finding information in a library, newspaper morgue, old tome, the internet, etc., uses the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Research]{Research} skill. As noted there, however, if the investigator’s Occult skill is higher she may use that instead.

Persuasion is the ability to convince others to do what you want through reason, cajoling, deception, rewards, or other friendly means. Persuasion isn’t mind control. It can change someone’s attitude but not their goals. A bandit may let you keep a sentimental piece of jewelry with a good Persuasion roll but still takes all your other goods.

When used to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03support0000000]{Support} allies it’s an unopposed roll. If the target is resistant, it’s an @JournalEntry[JBxsGv2wAoAmoCDe]{opposed} roll vs. the target’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Spirit}. The GM should modify the roll as she sees fit based on roleplaying, any pertinent @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edges} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01hindrances0000]{Hindrances} that affect the conversation, and the circumstances.

Reaction Level: How much a person is willing to cooperate depends largely on their attitude toward whoever’s talking to them. The Game Master can decide how nonplayer characters feel based on the setting, or roll on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.Reaction Table]{Reaction Table} if she has no preconceived notions.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Success} improves the target’s attitude one level and a raise improves it two. Further increases aren’t generally possible in the same encounter—it takes individuals a little time to adjust their biases.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Failure} means the target won’t change his mind this scene or until the situation changes in some important way. A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure} also reduces the target’s attitude two levels.

Only one roll should generally be allowed per interaction unless new information is revealed, a substantial reward is offered, etc.

Networking: Characters can also use Persuasion as a “macro skill,” simulating a few hours or an evening’s time hobnobbing and socializing to gain favors or information. See @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04networking0000]{Networking}.

Stealth is the ability to hide and move quietly. A simple @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{success} on a Stealth roll means the character avoids detection if enemies aren’t particularly alert. If the character @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{fails} the roll, the enemy realizes something is amiss and begins actively searching for whatever roused them.

Once foes are alerted and active, Stealth is opposed by @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} (a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{group roll} if there are many foes.

The GM should apply any circumstantial penalties to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} rolls for @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03illumination00]{darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03coverandobst00]{cover}, noise, distractions, and any difference in the target’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Size and Scale]{Scale} (just like when attacking). Sneaking through dry leaves might subtract 2 from the Stealth roll, for example, while spotting someone in the dark uses the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03illumination00]{Illumination} penalty (−4). Don’t apply the same modifier to both rolls, however. If Stealth is at −2 for the leaves, don’t give Notice a +2 for them as well.

Sneak Attack: Sneaking up close enough to make a melee attack always requires an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{opposed} Stealth roll versus the target’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice}, whether the guard is actively looking for trouble or not. If successful, the victim is @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03distractedan00]{Vulnerable} to the attacker, but only until the attacker’s turn ends. With a raise, the attacker has @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03thedrop0000000]{The Drop} instead.

Movement: In combat, characters roll Stealth each turn as a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03actions0000000]{free action} at the end of their move or any action the GM thinks might draw attention.

Out of combat, the distance moved depends entirely on the situation. The GM might want a roll every minute if the group is sneaking around the perimeter of a defensive position, or every few miles if they’re trying to quietly walk the path through a dark forest without alerting the creatures that live there.

Survival allows a character to find food, water, or shelter in hostile environments. It can also be used to navigate wilderness environments, figure out which plants are good to eat and which aren’t, and so on.

A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{successful} Survival roll provides enough food and water for one person for one day; or five people with a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{raise}.

More detailed information on @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hunger00000000]{Hunger} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04thirst00000000]{Thirst} can be found under @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Hazards} section.

Tracking: Survival can also be used to detect and follow tracks. Each roll generally covers following the tracks for one mile, but the GM should adjust this as needed for specific circumstances.

The Game Master should assign a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{bonus or penalty} based on the target, environment, and time. Tracking a large group that recently passed through a snow-covered area might grant a bonus of +4, while following a single person over rocks and streams after more than a day incurs a −4 penalty.

effects.name: Armor +2
effects.description: Armor +2: Covered in plates of black chitin.

system.description: Armor +2: Covered in plates of black chitin.
Additional Actions: Tsucora quori ignore 2 points of Multi-Action penalties each turn.
